snippet.title: Detecting anomalies using Isolation Trees: Practical Machine Learning
snippet.description:
Production alerts are an important way in which engineers monitor the health of their services. The alerts are fired when important service metrics behave irregularly. An example would be a sudden spike in the number of errors or a crash in the number of running processes.

We design a system to allow important server metrics to be published, analysed and acted upon. The metrics are sent using sidecars in a service mesh. The metrics are then capped and run through machine learning algorithms like isolation trees to search for anomalies.

Service Mesh:
https://www.nginx.com/blog/what-is-a-service-mesh/

Isolation forest:
https://towardsdatascience.com/outlier-detection-with-isolation-forest-3d190448d45e
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12Xq9OLdQwQ

References:
https://eng.uber.com/argos/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRbrOQHpvNc&index=1&list=UUq4pm1i_VZqxKVVOz5qRBIA
https://machinelearningmastery.com/arima-for-time-series-forecasting-with-python/
http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.136.1949&rep=rep1&type=pdf
https://towardsdatascience.com/machine-learning-for-anomaly-detection-and-condition-monitoring-d4614e7de770
https://jotterbach.github.io/2016/03/24/Principal_Component_Analysis/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7X4pY8NYofg
http://rstudio-pubs-static.s3.amazonaws.com/150640_4ab884411f5d4b4c85f032cf3fe68aa0.html

Preparing for design Interviews?
https://get.interviewready.io/courses/system-design-interview-prep

#AnomalyDetection #MachineLearning #IsolationTrees
